message: i don't believe we did this, though, since we use the same style across all the titles
We posted the question on Stack Overflow, but so far, no answers ... anyone have any clues?

You can see the bug reproduced by simply loading up our site on the iPhone with Safari. You'll notice some of the title fonts are larger than others. For example, "Variations" is larger than "Translations." All titles should be the same size as "Translations."

We offer a service to help people brainstorm domain names at www.panabee.com?c, but our mobile version on Safari renders with a weird font size issue ... has anyone experienced a similar problem with their site? Basically, some of our fonts get rendered according to their CSS values and others get rendered at a much larger size.
BTW, any feedback on the site? Thanks in advance, Jim!
I've seen something similar when a developer mixed pt and px for fonts.
Did you figure out your font-size issue? I'm seeing the problem on one of the sites I maintain...

Resolution: iOS uses a CSS property (without asking) to increase some font sizes in an attempt to predict and repair what it thinks will be illegible on its smaller screen. To turn off that capability, assert "-webkit-text-size-adjust:none" in a CSS rule, or use em as the unit of font sizes. Be aware that disabling font-resizing might have side effects, and test!
